intro: Stylidium leptocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sunburst, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
